intro: Senecio breviscapus, commonly known as the short-stemmed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces achenes with pappus for wind dispersal. Senecio breviscapus is often found in open vegetation types such as shrublands and grasslands.
